page.title: 09NUCLEAR POWER PLANT/HEYSHAM
page.content: The recent building of a nuclear power plant at Heysham,begun in December 1970,has had a significant effect on the population of the area.The spate of house-building over the last 15 years, has been a direct result of this and the projected Gas Terminal. At present there are 2 reactor-turbine units in use,each with a capacity of 660 Megawatts-enough to supply 3 cities the size of Manchester.It employs 650 permanent staff to run it over its 30 year projected life.A second Advanced Gas-Cooled Reactor with similar output was begun in 1979,and is due for completion in 1987,creating another 650 jobs.
